meanings.definition: Buildup.
examples: Doctors are certain that smoking will eventually lead to an accumulation of health problems.

images.alt: Photo of swing with a layer of snow.
images.description: A picture of a swing seat with several inches of snow on it.
images.caption: When it is cold, snow can accumulate outslde.

images.description: Photo shows many bundles of papers, magazines, and newspapers, gathered in a large pile.
images.caption: Bundled paper accumulates in large piles.

meanings.definition: To argue against; to deny.
examples: Critics argue that these actions contradict statements by tobacco companies that they are trying to prevent kids from smoking.

images.alt: Photo of a dog next to a sign.
images.description: A dog is pictured next to a sign that says, that dogs are not allowed.
images.caption: The sign says that dogs are not allowed, but the dog is contradicting that message.

source.title: Dog Wars in DefCol new Delhi
source.author: vm2827

meanings.definition: To show; to display.
examples: Smokers often exhibit symptoms such as coughing, low energy, respiratory difficulties, and poor circulation.

images.description: Different types of dinosaur models are labeled in a museum presentation.
images.caption: A museum exhibit can show people new and interesting information.

source.title: Clevleand Museum of Natural History 08-21-2015 - Special Dinosaur Exhibit 10
source.author: David441491

meanings.definition: Unavoidable.
examples: It’s inevitable that you will disagree with your friends sometimes, but it’s important to respect their opinions.

meanings.definition: To show or explain the benefit of something in order to get money.
examples: The marketing worked so well that it made everyone think they needed to buy a new phone.

images.description: Photo of Times Square in New York City. Tall buildings surround the area. Billboards with advertising signs cover the buildings.
images.caption: Times Square is well known for advertisments that market and try to sell things to consumers.

meanings.definition: To be accepted as true.
examples: It is widely acknowledged that gas-powered cars create a lot of air pollution.

meanings.definition: In the end, especially after a while.
examples: Eventually, after a long winter and spring, summer will come again.

images.alt: Photo of a flower growing out of a layer of snow.
images.description: The photo shows a flower emerging after a long winter.
images.caption: After a long winter, spring will finally come and flowers will bloom.

meanings.definition: To actively support or draw attention to.
examples: I created a flyer for recycling because I want to publicize easy ways we can help the environment.

images.alt: Photo of two people in front of boxes and a sign.
images.description: Two people hold packages in their hands. Full boxes are on the ground, in the background. A sign says, Free Ramen.
images.caption: The sign informs people that there are free ramen noodles in the boxes.

meanings.definition: Attractive or able to hold one’s interest.
examples: I think it is appealing to experience a great action movie with friends.

meanings.definition: To show or explain the benefit of something in order to get money.
examples: The selling campaign worked so well that it made everyone think they needed to buy a new phone.

images.caption: Times Square is well known for advertisments that market and try to sell things to consumers.

examples: It is widely recognized that gas-powered cars create a lot of air pollution.

examples: Someday, after a long winter and spring, summer will come again.

meanings.definition: To be accepted as true.
examples: It is widely conceded that gas-powered cars create a lot of air pollution.

meanings.definition: In the end, especially after a while.
examples: Ultimately, after a long winter and spring, summer will come again.

images.description: The photo shows a flower emerging after a long winter.
images.caption: After a long winter, spring will finally come and flowers will bloom.

meanings.definition: To actively support or draw attention to.
examples: I created a flyer for recycling because I want to champion easy ways we can help the environment.

images.alt: Photo of two people in front of boxes and a sign.
images.description: Two people hold packages in their hands. Full boxes are on the ground, in the background. A sign says, Free Ramen.
images.caption: The sign informs people that there are free ramen noodles in the boxes.

meanings.definition: Attractive or able to hold one’s interest.
examples: I think it is captivating to experience the great action movie with friends.

meanings.definition: To influence, control, or persuade with skill and often dishonesty.
examples: Companies use appealing advertisements and other techniques to manipulate kids into buying cigarettes.

images.description: Child and adult hands shape a soft, wet clay pot.
images.caption: Some things, like soft clay, are easy to manipulate. Is it as easy to manipulate opinions?
